pass_1.paper_name: Radiation Effects Predicted, Observed, and Compared for Spacecraft Systems
pass_1.objective: The main objective of the paper is to document radiation effects observed in selected spacecraft at the system and subsystem levels, relate them to predicted radiation effects in parts, and provide guidance in designs of future spacecraft electronics to have improved tolerance to various radiation effects.

pass_3.paper_name: Radiation Effects Predicted, Observed, and Compared for Spacecraft Systems
pass_3.objective: The main objective of the paper is to document radiation effects observed in selected spacecraft at the system and subsystem levels, relate them to predicted radiation effects in parts, and provide guidance in designs of future spacecraft electronics to improve tolerance to various radiation effects.

parts.name: AM2901 bit-slice
parts.other_details: Radiation-hardened version known as SA2901, used in Galileo spacecraft

seeData.special_notes: No destructive latchups have been observed. The mission absorbed approximately four times more radiation than it was designed to (~600 krads vs. 150 krads) and continues to operate properly.

tidData.special_notes: The mission absorbed approximately four times more radiation than it was designed to (~600 krads vs. 150 krads) and continues to operate properly.

parts.other_details: Contains many SEE-sensitive parts, used in CHAMP, SAC-C, and Jason spacecraft

pass_1.paper_name: SEE In-Flight Data for two Static 32KB Memories on High Earth Orbit
pass_1.objective: The main objective of the paper is to present the detailed analysis of in-flight data obtained for two 32KB SRAMs over a four-year period in the MPTB orbit, focusing on the performance, reliability, and survivability of these devices in the space radiation environment.

parts.name: HM62256
parts.other_details: Entirely tested using Ram Static Test (RST) method. Observed for Single Event Upset (SEU) and stuck bits during solar events.

seeData.environmental_conditions: High latitude and altitude, solar events
seeData.special_notes: Stuck bits correlated to solar events, heavy ions presence assumed

tidData.environmental_conditions: High latitude and altitude, solar events
tidData.power_usage_description: Increased power usage observed during solar events
tidData.special_notes: Stuck bits correlated to solar events, heavy ions presence assumed

parts.name: HM65756
parts.other_details: Partly tested using Cyclic Redundancy Checksum (CRC) and Ram Static Test (RST) methods. Used for storage of T225 process workspaces and data.

seeData.environmental_conditions: High latitude and altitude, solar events
seeData.special_notes: Observed during solar events, heavy ions presence assumed

pass_2.paper_name: SEE in-flight data for two static 32KB memories on high earth orbit
pass_2.objective: The main objective of the paper is to analyze in-flight data concerning two 32KB SRAM types and to understand the contribution of proton radiation belts and solar events to the Single Event Upset (SEU) rates observed in these devices.

parts.name: HM62256
parts.other_details: Entirely tested using Ram Static Test (RST) method. Observed for Single Event Upset (SEU) detection and stuck bits during solar events.

seeData.environmental_conditions: High latitude and altitude, solar events
seeData.special_notes: Stuck bits observed during solar events, indicating presence of heavy ions.

tidData.environmental_conditions: High latitude and altitude, solar events
tidData.power_usage_description: Increased during solar events, indicating presence of heavy ions.
tidData.failing_time: Few hours to almost a month
tidData.special_notes: Stuck bits observed during solar events, indicating presence of heavy ions.

parts.name: HM65756
parts.other_details: Partly tested using both Cyclic Redundancy Checksum (CRC) and Ram Static Test (RST) methods. Used for storage of T225 process workspaces and data.

seeData.environmental_conditions: High latitude and altitude, solar events
seeData.special_notes: The SEU rate is correlated to high energy proton flux but the amplitude is not conserved.

pass_3.paper_name: SEE In-Flight Data for two Static 32KB Memories on High Earth Orbit
pass_3.objective: The main objective of the paper is to present the detailed analysis of in-flight data obtained for two 32KB SRAMs in the MPTB orbit, focusing on the performance, reliability, and survivability of these devices in the space radiation environment over a 4-year period.

parts.name: HM62256
parts.other_details: The entire HM62256 device is operated for SEE detection. A dedicated circuit is used for Latchup detection and protection of the devices.

seeData.environmental_conditions: High energy protons and heavy ions from Galactic Cosmic Rays and Solar Event Protons
seeData.special_notes: The major contribution to the SEU rates comes from the proton radiation belts. The behavior of tested devices during different solar events showed increases with factors up to 60 for the induced error rate.

tidData.environmental_conditions: High energy protons and heavy ions from Galactic Cosmic Rays and Solar Event Protons
tidData.power_usage_description: Increased power usage observed during solar events, correlating with stuck bits occurrence.
tidData.failing_time: Several hours to almost a month
tidData.special_notes: The TID effect makes the devices more sensitive to stuck bits, and additional dose during solar events may be sufficient to affect the most degraded memory cells.

parts.name: HM65756
parts.other_details: The HM65756 device is used for the storage of the T225 process workspaces and data, and 2Kbytes are reserved for telemetry and telecommand purposes. Only 70% of its memory plan is observed for upset detection.

seeData.environmental_conditions: High energy protons and heavy ions from Galactic Cosmic Rays and Solar Event Protons
seeData.special_notes: The SEU rate is significantly influenced by solar events, with a notable increase during such periods.

pass_1.paper_name: Single-Event Effects Measurements on COTS Electronic Devices for Use on NASA Mars Missions
pass_1.objective: The main objective of the paper is to report recent single-event effects measurements results for a variety of microelectronic devices to evaluate these devices for possible use in NASA Mars missions.

parts.name: SN74LVC2T45
parts.other_details: Dual-bit dual-supply bus transceiver with configurable voltage translation

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C
seeData.special_notes: No SELs or SETs were observed

parts.name: TCA9517
parts.other_details: Level-shifting I2C bus repeater

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C
seeData.special_notes: 37 positive SET events were captured

parts.name: TC7WZ126FK
parts.other_details: Dual bus buffer with 3-state output

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C
seeData.special_notes: No SELs or SETs were observed

parts.name: TPS62130
parts.other_details: 3 to 17 V, 3A step-down converter

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C
seeData.special_notes: Minor negative and positive SETs were observed in the loaded condition

parts.name: ADP195
parts.other_details: Logic controlled, high-side power switch with reverse current blocking

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C
seeData.special_notes: Handful of SELs were observed at elevated temperature only

parts.name: TPS25942
parts.other_details: 18 V, 5 A eFuse power mux with multiple protection modes

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C
seeData.special_notes: 208 events observed; majority were tiny negative going transients

parts.name: CC1190
parts.other_details: 950MHz RF front end

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C
seeData.special_notes: SEFIs resulted in test application hangs but were recoverable with a reset

parts.name: CC1200
parts.other_details: Low-power, high-performance RF transceiver with analog features

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C
seeData.special_notes: SELs were observed at LETs as low as 20Ne

parts.name: CC1310
parts.other_details: RF Range Extender

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C
seeData.special_notes: SEFIs were observed at LETs as low as 40Ar and were recoverable with a reset

parts.name: LT8612
parts.other_details: 3.4 to 42 V, 6A synchronous step-down regulator

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C
seeData.special_notes: SEFIs were observed at LETs as low as 40Ar and were recoverable with a reset

pass_2.paper_name: Single-Event Effects Measurements on COTS Electronic Devices for Use on NASA Mars Missions
pass_2.objective: The main objective of the paper is to report recent single-event effects measurements results for a variety of microelectronic devices to evaluate these devices for possible use in NASA Mars missions.

parts.name: SN74LVC2T45
parts.other_details: Dual-bit dual-supply bus transceiver with configurable voltage translation.

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C, in air with normal incident beam
seeData.special_notes: No SELs or SETs were observed

parts.name: TCA9517
parts.other_details: Level-shifting I2C bus repeater.

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C, in air with normal incident beam
seeData.special_notes: 37 positive SET events were observed with SCLA set to 0 V

parts.name: TC7WZ126FK
parts.other_details: Dual bus buffer with 3-state output.

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C, in air with normal incident beam
seeData.special_notes: No SELs or SETs were observed

parts.name: TPS62130
parts.other_details: 3 to 17 V, 3A step-down converter.

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C, in air with normal incident beam
seeData.special_notes: Minor negative and positive SETs were observed in the loaded condition

parts.name: ADP195
parts.other_details: Logic controlled, high-side power switch with reverse current blocking.

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C, in air with normal incident beam
seeData.special_notes: Handful of SELs were observed at elevated temperature only; five recoverable SEFIs were observed with the 200-mA load condition

parts.name: TPS25942
parts.other_details: 18 V, 5 A eFuse power mux with multiple protection modes.

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C, in air with normal incident beam
seeData.special_notes: 208 events observed; majority were tiny negative going transients with an amplitude of less than 500 mV and a pulse width of 500 µs

parts.name: CC1190
parts.other_details: 950MHz RF front end.

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C, in air with normal incident beam
seeData.special_notes: SEFIs resulted in test application hangs but were recoverable with a reset

parts.name: CC1200
parts.other_details: Low-power, high-performance RF transceiver with analog features.

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C, in air with normal incident beam
seeData.special_notes: SELs were observed at LETs as low as 20Ne; components were still functional with nominal supply current after performing these measurements

parts.name: CC1310
parts.other_details: RF Range Extender.

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C, in air with normal incident beam
seeData.special_notes: SEFIs were observed at LETs as low as 40Ar and were recoverable with a reset

parts.name: LT8612
parts.other_details: 3.4 to 42 V, 6A synchronous step-down regulator.

seeData.environmental_conditions: Tested at room temperature and at 70°C, in air with normal incident beam
seeData.special_notes: Small amount of self-recovery SEFIs in the form of output drop-outs were observed at 61.6 and 47 MeV-cm2/mg

pass_1.paper_name: Review of TID Effects Reported in ProASIC3 and ProASIC3L FPGAs for 3D PLUS Camera Heads
pass_1.objective: The main objective of the paper is to compare original TID data from ProASIC3L FPGAs with existing literature, discuss the impact of different test flows on the TID response, and correlate the data with TID tests of 3D PLUS camera heads.

parts.name: A3PE3000L
parts.other_details: Flash-based FPGA used in 3D PLUS space camera head module, tested for TID effects with a focus on signal propagation delay.

tidData.environmental_conditions: Static, no clock applied, no I/O operations performed
tidData.power_usage_description: Standby power consumption decreased by over 85% at 60 krad
tidData.special_notes: Functional recovery observed after annealing at 100°C

pass_2.paper_name: Review of TID Effects Reported in ProASIC3 and ProASIC3L FPGAs for 3D PLUS Camera Heads
pass_2.objective: The main objective of the paper is to compare original TID data from ProASIC3L FPGAs with existing literature, discuss the impact of different test flows on the TID response, and correlate the data with TID tests of 3D PLUS camera heads.

parts.name: A3PE3000L
parts.other_details: Part of the ProASIC3L family, used in 3D PLUS space camera head module, tested for TID effects.

tidData.environmental_conditions: Static, no clock applied, no I/O operations performed
tidData.power_usage_description: Standby power consumption decreased by over 85% at 60 krad
tidData.failing_time: After 60 krad, DUT completely lost functionality
tidData.special_notes: Functional recovery observed after A2 annealing step

pass_3.paper_name: Review of TID Effects Reported in ProASIC3 and ProASIC3L FPGAs for 3D PLUS Camera Heads
pass_3.objective: This paper compares original TID data from ProASIC3L FPGAs with existing literature, discusses the impact of different test flows on the TID response, and correlates the data with TID tests of 3D PLUS camera heads.

parts.name: A3PE3000L
parts.other_details: Flash-based FPGA used in 3D PLUS space camera head module, tested for TID effects with a focus on signal propagation delay and annealing effects.

tidData.environmental_conditions: Static, no clock applied, no I/O operations performed
tidData.power_usage_description: Standby power consumption decreased by over 85% at 60 krad
tidData.special_notes: Functional recovery observed after annealing at 100°C for 168 hours
